meanings.definition: To hold or form a caucus.
meanings.sent1: The group caucused to discuss their plans for the project.
meanings.sent2: The members caucused in the library to decide on the next event.
meanings.sent3: The friends caucused in the park, making decisions on where to have a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The birds caucused in the trees, chirping loudly to communicate.
meanings.sent5: The students caucused in the classroom, eager to share their ideas.

meanings.definition: To meet in or hold a caucus.
meanings.sent1: The team caucused before the game to discuss their strategy.
meanings.sent2: The politicians caucused in the conference room to negotiate the bill.
meanings.sent3: The animals caucused in the barn, deciding who gets to eat first.
meanings.sent4: The clouds caucused in the sky, forming shapes that looked like animals.
meanings.sent5: The family caucused in the living room, planning their vacation together.
